content.raw: There's still some changes in [branch gzmodify_scpeters_shasum](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/gzmodify_scpeters_shasum..gzmodify#diff) that uses shasum comparisons instead of the header file with super-size string constants (to prevent a reversion of #803). ~~I probably need to merge changes forward and test it again though.~~ I just merged in the latest changes to gzmodify.
content.html: There's still some changes in branch gzmodify_scpeters_shasum that uses shasum comparisons instead of the header file with super-size string constants (to prevent a reversion of #803). I probably need to merge changes forward and test it again though. I just merged in the latest changes to gzmodify.

gz_topic.cc is still using the deprecated gazebo api's:
~~~
tools/gz_topic.cc:326:16: warning: 'load' is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
  if (!gazebo::load())
               ^
tools/gz_topic.cc:332:11: warning: 'run' is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
  gazebo::run();
          ^

  if (!gazebo::init())
               ^
tools/gz_topic.cc:378:11: warning: 'fini' is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
  gazebo::fini();
          ^
~~~

content.raw: Take a look at this [pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/79) which is needed to fix the `gz` unit test.
content.html: Take a look at this pull request which is needed to fix the gz unit test.

content.raw:
In my opinion, we shouldn't have to update the models for this test to pass. The test seems brittle to me. It feels like we throw away one of the advantages of the automatic converter script by always updating the models when we bump the sdf version. I created
[sdformat issue 44](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issue/44/parse-old-versions-of-sdf-files-without)
to discuss this.
content.html: In my opinion, we shouldn't have to update the models for this test to pass. The test seems brittle to me. It feels like we throw away one of the advantages of the automatic converter script by always updating the models when we bump the sdf version. I created sdformat issue 44 to discuss this.

content.raw: The other option would be to silently convert any file without a warning. This would be cleaner, but I believe silent conversion was not very popular.
content.html: The other option would be to silently convert any file without a warning. This would be cleaner, but I believe silent conversion was not very popular.

content.raw: I wouldn't recommend an in-place conversion, but a dynamic conversion of the loaded sdf file at runtime. This may be bad for performance reasons, but there are maintenance advantages.
content.html: I wouldn't recommend an in-place conversion, but a dynamic conversion of the loaded sdf file at runtime. This may be bad for performance reasons, but there are maintenance advantages.

